passage_text: Sodium is a chemical element with the chemical symbol Na. It is an alkali metal with the atomic number 11. We know that substances are made up of various atoms, and each atom has a specific chemical identity. It (an atom) is said to be chemical element, and has all the characteristics of that element. The atom is the smallest unit into which a chemical element can be divided.

Elements and Compounds. 1  Element-An element is a substance composed of the same type of atoms (e.g. gold Au, oxygen O 2). 2  Compound-A compound is a substance made of more than one type of atom (e.g. water H 2 O, carbon dioxide CO 2). 3  Molecule-A molecule is the smallest particle of either an element or a compound.

Sodium is a chemical element with the chemical symbol Na. It is an alkali metal with the atomic number 11. We know that substances are made up of various atoms, and each atom … has a specific chemical identity. It (an atom) is said to be chemical element, and has all the characteristics of that element.

Elements and compounds are pure chemical substances found in nature. The difference between an element and a compound is that an element is a substance made of same type of atoms, whereas a compound is made of different elements in definite proportions. Examples of elements include iron, copper, hydrogen and oxygen.
